The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies

wikitext.*:
'''Messrs Grubb, Grubb and Burrowes''' was a notary firm in [[the Shire]] led by two [[Grubb]]s and one [[Burrowes]]. They were probably lawyers or auctioneers.<ref>{{HM|Guide}}, p. 260</ref>

==History==
Grubb, Grubb and Burrowes oversaw the auction of [[Bilbo Baggins]]' estate after the hobbit went missing in {{SR|1341}}.<ref>{{H|Return}}</ref> 
==Other versions of the legendarium==
In early drafts of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', Messrs. [[Iago Grubb]] and [[Folco Burrowes]] are [[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]]'s (at that stage called Bingo) lawyers and eject [[Sancho Proudfoot]] who was trying to steal from the pantry in the chaos of hobbits trying to collect their parting gifts from Bilbo.<ref>{{RS|1Iiii}}</ref>
== Portrayal in adaptations ==
'''2014: ''[[The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies]]'':'''
:[[Tosser Grubb]] leads the auction on behalf of the firm.
